fields.caption: For the past decade, sand sculpture artists have gathered every year in Tottori, Japan, at the world’s only indoor sand museum, to mount an exhibit of intricate tableaus.

This year, 19 artists from countries including Canada, China, Italy, the Netherlands and Russia traveled to Tottori to sculpt scenes on the theme of the United States. Previous themes have included Africa, Russia and South America.
One display depicted the signing of the Declaration of Independence.
Undulating golden dunes stretch for about 10 miles along the coast of Tottori, so majestic they have been turned into a national park.
